sn56.39:1.1: “Mendicants, there are ascetics and brahmins who don’t truly understand about suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path.
sn56.39:1.2: They gaze up at the face of another ascetic or brahmin, thinking:
sn56.39:1.3: ‘Surely this worthy one knows and sees.’
sn56.39:2.1: Suppose there was a light tuft of cotton-wool or kapok which was taken up by the wind and landed on level ground.
sn56.39:2.2: The east wind wafts it west; the west wind wafts it east; the north wind wafts it south; and the south wind wafts it north.
sn56.39:2.4: It’s because the tuft of cotton-wool is so light.
sn56.39:2.5: In the same way, there are ascetics and brahmins who don’t truly understand about suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path.
sn56.39:2.6: They gaze up at the face of another ascetic or brahmin, thinking:
sn56.39:2.7: ‘Surely this worthy one knows and sees.’
sn56.39:2.9: It’s because they haven’t seen the four noble truths.
sn56.39:3.1: There are ascetics and brahmins who truly understand about suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path.
sn56.39:3.2: They don’t gaze up at the face of another ascetic or brahmin, thinking:
sn56.39:3.3: ‘Surely this worthy one knows and sees.’
sn56.39:4.1: Suppose there was an iron pillar or a boundary pillar with deep foundations, firmly embedded, imperturbable and unshakable.
sn56.39:4.2: Even if violent storms were to blow up out of the east, the west, the north, and the south, they couldn’t make it shake or rock or tremble.
sn56.39:4.4: It’s because that boundary pillar is firmly embedded, with deep foundations.
sn56.39:4.5: In the same way, there are ascetics and brahmins who truly understand about suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path.
sn56.39:4.6: They don’t gaze up at the face of another ascetic or brahmin, thinking:
sn56.39:4.7: ‘Surely this worthy one knows and sees.’
sn56.39:4.9: It’s because they have clearly seen the four noble truths.
sn56.39:4.11: The noble truths of suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path.
sn56.39:5.1: That’s why you should practice meditation …”
